numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a generational divide between youths and adults.
2. Someone asked a question.
3. The question was: Is the world getting better with each generation?
4. Youth aged 15-24 seemed more optimistic than adults aged 40+.
5. This difference was especially visible in first-world countries.
6. The US is a first-world country.
7. The UK is a first-world country.
8. Japan is a first-world country.
9. Germany is a first-world country.
10. Only 3 of 20 countries have older generations who believe that the world is improving.
11. I wonder about the countries that are not mentioned.
12. I wonder whether older generations in the countries that are not mentioned believe that the world is not improving at all.
13. I wonder whether people aged 15-24 will have a different mindset as time goes on.
14. The world keeps changing.
15. I wonder what factors contribute to the perception of the populace.
16. The perception is about whether the world is becoming a better place.
17. This relates to me and my community.
18. I am part of the youth.
19. I am surrounded by people of my age group at school.
20. I have older parents.
21. My parents are cultured.
22. I have older family members.
23. I can see different mindsets between the youth and the older generation first hand.
24. I noticed that older generations make generalizations about younger generations.
25. There is a common agreement among each side.
26. Many people aged 15-24 find themselves in line with each other.
27. Many people aged 15-24 feel that the world is becoming a better place.
28. This happens as generations move forward.
29. The headline is: The Battle Between Generations: Where Is The World Headed?
